entry.title: Ross County v Celtic - News & Team prediction
entry.summary:
Photo by Robert Perry/PA Images via Getty Images
So tomorrow - the well documented game that we won’t be able to watch legally in the draconian backwater that is Scotland. Let’s be honest, this country is crap. From the state of our city centres decaying and overpriced, the trains literally never running on time - ever - and the way football fans are treated here, it’s genuinely a surprise we even bother. We put up with it all for Celtic, somehow. It’s back to Dingwall tomorrow and here’s our predicted XI: Hart Juranovic Welsh CCV Taylor McGregor O’Riley Turnbull Maeda Kyogo Jota.
We did say on GIGPOD that we’d have Ralston in for JJ, Jota on the left and Abada for Maeda, with Hatate injured, it means David Turnbull slots back in and can prove his worth to the side. 67HailHail did a video earlier today previewing the game in depth:
And here was Ange’s press conference this afternoon:
Shoot Prediction: Ross County 1-3 Celtic.

entry.title: Rogic update after Scottish media jackanory
entry.summary:
Photo by Ian MacNicol/Getty Images
It’s fair to say it’s been a slow week at Celtic after Sunday’s win. The news coming out of the club has been generally non existent and we’re sure that’ll not be the case when we’re playing in the CL and the League cup onwards at the end of this month, alongside being in league duty too. Ange’s presser ahead of Saturday’s game - a 3pm blackout of course - at Ross County will be tomorrow afternoon although we’re not sure what fan media will be representing at that one alongside the usual press lot. Either way, it’ll be interesting to hear Ange after he was less than impressed on Sunday with our sloppiness at times during the game, and of course if he’s going to be rotating the team. In the meantime, weird reports appeared last night and this morning that Tom Rogic was linking up with Neil Lennon in Cyprus, following his decision to leave Celtic in May.
Celtic hero Tom Rogic 'close' to reunion with Neil Lennon as shock Omonia transfer claim emergeshttps://t.co/b5og2JgFfZ pic.twitter.com/vE8LPL80kd— Daily Record Sport (@Record_Sport) August 4, 2022
THANKFULLY, this is nonsense as the ever reliable 67 Hail Hail have discovered. Read THIS ARTICLE to soothe your fears and reassure you that our ex Australian magician has not lost his head this summer.
